results.definition: a verbal formula believed to have magical force
examples: he whispered a spell as he moved his hands

results.definition: write or name the letters that comprise the conventionally accepted form of (a word or part of a word)
examples: He spelled the word wrong in this letter

results.definition: a psychological state induced by (or as if induced by) a magical incantation
a time period for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
a period of indeterminate length (usually short) marked by some action or condition
orally recite the letters of or give the spelling of
examples: How do you spell this word?
We had to spell out our names for the police officer

results.definition: relieve (someone) from work by taking a turn
examples: She spelled her husband at the wheel
the workers spell every four hours
